topics.body: What's worse is that I got a buggy copy, and the game completely refused to let me advance. For a while, I thought I just wasn't paying attention enough to the pressings and that I perhaps wasn't looking at the evidence clearly enough, but after walking it through with my boyfriend (who's played all of them), he agree that something was wrong. I'd get to the point where the prosecutor was supposed to ask me if I could prove something...but I would never get the option, Phoenix would just go into a rant about how the witness' testimony was perfect. Luckily, restarting the chapter cleared whatever that was up.

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad1dcc6368721438002388#post_55ad1dcc6368721438002388

Yeah. For example, in the first case I did, the victim's body had crushed glasses under it. The witness to the crime mentioned how much he loved _glasses_, even though he wasn't currently wearing any (apparently, he "lost" them). Kind of easy. And at the end of the case, yes, that ended up being the deciding evidence. But you have to decide when the right time to bring that up is, otherwise the judge penalizes you. 

That's kind of simple, though. Sometimes you have to press witnesses and then drop your questions in the right order for anything to happen. Knowing when to drop or when to continue questioning can be bit of an issue.

"@ice1517":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad1e7e6368725dcb001127#post_55ad1e7e6368725dcb001127

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad20246368720229001165#post_55ad20246368720229001165

I can't really complain because the game lets you save whenever you want, so you can always just restart if you screw up. Though you're right, if you truly have no idea what the hell to do, throwing evidence everywhere is usually a good place to start.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad20086368724e57001805#post_55ad20086368724e57001805
You also have to look at the (somewhat creepy-looking) faces of witnesses and the perps to succeed. Though I think the whole sandbox aspect should be dropped. Oh, and BTW, you can change the game's graphics to look more like a 30s detective film.
